intro: Uruparia sessilifructus, commonly known as the sessile-fruited uruparia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is typically found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
